tok: olin mi li lukin e sina la, ona li kama pilin pona a li wile awen lukin e sina. taso sina tawa tan mi. mi sona ala: sina pali e ni tan seme?
eng: My heart beats happily when it sees you. My eyes, smiling, follow you, searching for you. But still, you run away from me, I don't know why.

tok: ale li ijo pi mani mute lon esun ni.
eng: Everything is very expensive in this store.

tok: tenpo ni la tenpo seme lon ma tomo Lanten?
eng: What time is it in London now?

tok: lon tenpo ala.
ijo li lon linja lawa sina.
o ken ala e ni: jan lili sina li tawa lon linja telo ni.
eng: Don't let your children swim in this river.

tok: lipu pi ma Pasila li jo e kule tu wan. ona li laso jelo li jelo li laso.
eng: The Brazilian flag has three colors: it is green, yellow, and blue.

tok: jan li telo e soweli mi la, ni li pona ala tawa ona.
eng: My cat does not like bathing.

tok: mi pana e pakala pi mute lili.
ko walo lete li sama len lon nena.
eng: The mountain is covered with snow.

tok: mi insa wan e kon pi ijo ni la mi kama pilin jaki.
eng: One sniff of that stuff was enough to make me sick.

tok: sina pali ala pali lon tenpo suno kama?
eng: Are you going to work tomorrow?

tok: mi toki e ale.
mi ante e ijo ala lon tomo ona.
eng: We changed nothing in her room.

tok: lipu pi ma Epanja li loje li jelo.
eng: The Spanish flag is red and yellow.

tok: jan pona o, sina sona ala sona e ni: sina soweli?
eng: Sir, are you aware you are a cat?

tok: utala suli li pali e ni: jan pona li kama jan akesi.
soweli tomo li pakala e mi.
mi toki ala e nimi.
mi lukin e ni lon lape: mi mute li lon poka pi telo suli.
eng: I dreamt that we were at the beach.

tok: soweli tomo li lukin e soweli lili li tawa wawa lon monsi ona.
eng: The cat saw a mouse and ran after it.

tok: soweli tomo li lukin e soweli lili li tawa wawa lon monsi ona.
eng: The cat saw a mouse and ran after it.

tok: tenpo ala la sina pana e ijo tawa mi.
jan Ton o, sina jan pona mi.
o moku ala e telo ni.
mi toki insa e ni: mi pona tawa jan ala tan seme?
eng: I wonder why nobody likes me.

tok: mi wile kama sona e toki Kanse e toki Inli.
eng: I want to learn to speak French and English.

tok: jan Ton li wile ala e mani.
sina pana e ale tawa ona.
nanpa ni li pona tawa mi.
sina pana e ale tawa ona.
sina sona ala sona e jan pi toki Nijon?
eng: Do you know anyone who speaks Japanese?

tok: ni li pona e pali ni: jan li sitelen e nimi kepeken toki ante.
ni li pona e pali pi mi mute.
mi awen lon tomo.
tenpo pini la jan Kitopolo Kolonpo li kama jo e poki telo pi jan Jesuwa, taso ona li weka e ona tan ni: kule pi poki telo li ike tawa ona.
eng: Christopher Columbus once found the Holy Grail but threw it out because he didn't like the color.

tok: jan li moli e jan li lon poka mi.
eng: There is a killer among us.

tok: ala. mi pilin e ni: ni li ken: linja ni pi nena kiwen li pini.
eng: On the contrary, I think it may turn out that this rugged mountain range trails off at some point.

tok: jan Ton li pana e lipu lon supa sitelen ona.
eng: Tom puts a book on his desk.

tok: ni li kulupu pini anu seme?
ni ale li kama pini kepeken tenpo lili sama open ona.
eng: It all ended as suddenly as it started.

tok: mi weka wawa e lipu tan palisa pi sinpin open li pana e ona lon poki len mi li mu.
eng: I tore the paper from the gatepost and put it in my pocket with a sigh.

tok: mi ike lukin.
ona li lon ala ilo Tatowepa la ona li toki ala.
eng: If it isn't on Tatoeba, it isn't a sentence.

tok: mi tawa ma pali.
eng: I'm going to go to work.

tok: soweli tomo tu li lape.
mi awen lon tomo tan ni: sijelo mi li ike.
eng: I stayed at home because I was sick.

tok: ona li pini moku la, pilin lape li kama tawa ona.
eng: He always gets sleepy after eating.

tok: soweli tomo li utala uta e mi.
kon sewi li ike a! tan ni la jan li wile ala tawa tan tomo.
eng: The weather is so bad that you don't want to go outside.

tok: mi wile pana e tomo mi lon esun.
eng: Our house is up for sale.

tok: poki moku li lon ilo poki seli.
eng: The pot is on the stove.

tok: o moku e telo nasa kili kepeken tenpo suli. o moku ala e ona kepeken tenpo lili lili.
eng: Wine should be savored, not drunk in one gulp.

tok: o weka e ike mi, mi kute ala.
o weka e ike mi, mi kute ala.
mi sona e ni: ni li pona tawa waso.
mi sona e waso kepeken nasin ni.
mi sona e waso sama ni.
o luka ala e sinpin! kule li telo lon tenpo ni!
eng: Don't touch the walls! The paint is still fresh!

tok: ale li ante lon tenpo pi lili mute ni: ona li pana e pilin ike tawa mi.
eng: Things are changing so fast it scares me.

tok: mi sona ala e ni: ni li olin ala olin. (kin la, jan seme li sona e ni: olin li seme?) taso, mi sona wawa e ni: mi wile lon poka sina.
eng: I don't know whether this is love or not (after all, who ever knows what love is?), but one thing I know for sure: I want to be with you.

tok: jan seme li telo e ilo moku lon pini moku pi tenpo pimeja?
eng: Who'll wash the dishes after dinner?

tok: meli nanpa wan pi jan Ton li jo e nimi Mawina.
eng: Tom's first wife was named Marina.

tok: mi mute o toki kepeken toki Losi.
ona li kama lukin e meli. meli ni li pana e pona tawa ona.
eng: She found a woman who helped her.

tok: jan wan o olin e jan ante. jan ante o olin e jan wan.
mi en sina li wan li awen lon tenpo pimeja ni.
tenpo pimeja ni li tawa weka lon tenpo lili.
sike suno ni la tenpo suno pi mama meli ale li tenpo suno nanpa luka tu wan pi tenpo mun nanpa luka.
eng: This year, Mother's Day is May 8th.

tok: open sona li kama lon pini lon.
eng: The dawn of knowledge comes at the sunset of life.

tok: pilin ni li pona ala pona tawa sina?
eng: What do you think of this idea?

tok: tenpo suno ni li tenpo suno nanpa luka tu tu pi tenpo mun nanpa luka.
eng: Today is the ninth of May.

tok: jan Iwan li kama lon ni lon tenpo suno nanpa luka tu pi tenpo mun nanpa luka.
eng: Ivan arrived here on the seventh of May.

tok: tomo tawa linja li kama anu seme?
tenpo pi seli lili la lipu kasi li kama jelo li kama loje.
eng: In autumn, the leaves turn yellow and red.

tok: mi kama tan tomo lipu. mi tawa tomo mi.
eng: I come from the library and I am going home.

tok: mi wile e ni: jan Mewi li olin e mi e jan Ton ala.
eng: I wanted Mary to love me instead of Tom.

tok: nasin li kama ante.
ona li jo e pilin kiwen!
eng: She has a heart of stone!

tok: telo ala li lon insa pi poki mi.
mi wile ala olin lili e ona.
eng: I have no intention of dating her.

tok: sewi o, pona!
sina pali e ni: mi kama lon tenpo ike.
eng: It's because of you that we were late.

tok: sina jan pona mi wan taso.
eng: You're the only friend I have.

tok: jan Ton li lon poka ala e meli ona
nasin mi li pona nanpa wan tan ni: mi sona e nasin ni taso.
eng: My way is better because it's the only way I know.

tok: tenpo suno pini la mi pona e tomo tawa.
pipi pi ko suwi li pali ala, la kasi kule li pana ala e kili.
eng: If the bees do not work, the flowers will not bear fruit.

tok: ona li sitelen e linja nimi mute lon toki pona. taso ona li wile ala kama sona e toki ni.
eng: He writes a lot of sentences in Toki Pona, but he doesn't like to study that language.

tok: jan ni li jan pona suli mi.
eng: This person is the best friend I have in the world.

tok: tenpo wan la mi lukin e sitelen pona. akesi linja li moku e soweli suli.
eng: I once saw in a book a wonderful picture of a boa constrictor swallowing some big game.

tok: mi toki tawa jan suli: "o lukin! sina pilin ike ala ike tan sitelen ni?"
eng: I showed my masterpiece to the grown-ups and asked them if my drawing scared them.

tok: ona li toki: "mi pilin ike tan len lawa anu seme?"
eng: They answered me: “Why would a hat be scary?"

tok: jan lawa sewi li lon tomo lawa.
ona li tenpo kama.
mi moku e telo.
jan lili mi li kama sona toki.
eng: My little son is learning to talk.

tok: tenpo suli la mi kama sona e toki pona.
eng: I've been learning Toki Pona for a long time.

tok: tenpo ala la mi sona wawa e toki pona. taso mi awen kama sona e toki ni.
eng: I will never be fluent in Toki Pona, but I keep on learning that language.

tok: telo li kama kon.
mi sona pona e ijo pi esun mi.
mi toki e ona. taso mi pilin ala e ona.
jan pona mi li sona e toki musi ale mi. jan pi pona mute mi li lon toki musi mi.
eng: Good friends know all our stories. Best friends are part of them.

tok: soweli mi li sona e toki Epelanto. taso ona li ken ala toki kepeken ona.
eng: My dog understands Esperanto but can't speak it.

tok: mi sitelen e ale tan ni: mi ken ala awen sona e ijo.
eng: I wrote everything down because I can't remember anything.

tok: luka sina li jaki.
tenpo ale la jan pona pi kama sona li kama tawa tomo sona lon tenpo pona.
eng: Good students always arrive early to school.

tok: "sina kama sona e toki Intelinwa tan seme?" "tan ni: ona li pona mute."
eng: "Why do you study Interlingua?" "Because it's so easy."

tok: tenpo suno pini la mi kama sona e meli sama sina. ona li meli pi pona lukin mute.
eng: Yesterday I met your sister. She is a very nice lady.

tok: mama mi en mama sina li wile ala e ni: mi en sina li kulupu.
eng: Our parents won't let us meet.

tok: sina en mi li jan sama.
ona li jan pona sina, la ona li pali ala e ni.
eng: If he were your friend, he wouldn't have done it.

tok: sina sona ala sona e ni: esun pi poka nanpa wan, pi ilo pi pona sijelo li lon seme?
eng: Do you know where the nearest pharmacy is?

tok: sina ken ala ken toki e ni tawa mi: sina kama sona e ona lon seme?
eng: Can you tell me where you learned this?

tok: sina en mi li wile kama sona e ijo. wile sina li sama wile mi.
eng: You are as studious as I am.

tok: ona li toki pona kepeken toki Kanse.
eng: He knows how to express himself in good French.

tok: toki pona la nasin nimi li ante e kon pi linja nimi.
eng: In Toki Pona, the order of factors changes the product.

tok: "jan li kama sona e toki lon nasin seme?" "mi sona ala e ni."
eng: "How do you learn a language?" "I don't know."

tok: jan li jo ala jo e toki ante pona pi linja nimi ni?
eng: Does anyone have a good translation for this sentence?

tok: ona li toki e ni: mi nasa ala.
eng: They said that they aren't mad.

tok: telo li kama tan sewi lon tenpo suno kama la jan Ton li kama ala.
eng: If it rains tomorrow, Tom won't come.

tok: jan Mewi li pilin e ijo ante.
eng: Mary is thinking of something else.

tok: mi tawa tomo telo.
mi jaki uta.
ilo tawa linja li tawa tan tomo ona.
eng: The train is leaving the station.

tok: ilo tawa linja li tawa tan tomo ona.
eng: The train is leaving the station.

tok: telo nasa pan li pona mute tawa mi.
waso li lon ala.
lete pi mute ni li lon ala.
jan Ton li pona tawa jan.
ona li tawa sewi tan ni: ona li wile lukin e ni: ona li pini ala pini e suno pi tomo moku.
eng: He got up to see if he had turned off the light in the kitchen.

tok: soweli li mu mute tawa mi lon sinpin li ken ala e ni: mi tawa insa.
eng: The dog kept barking at me at the gate and kept me from coming in.

tok: sina jan seme? sina pali e seme lon ni?
eng: Who are you and what are you doing here?

tok: telo li kama kon.
sina sona e seme olin?
eng: What do you know about love?

tok: ale li musi la ale li jo e kon.
eng: When life is a joy, then life has meaning.

tok: laso kasi en jelo en laso pimeja li kule lon len pi ma Pasila.
eng: Green, yellow and dark blue are the colors of the Brazilian flag.

tok: ona li moli lili lon tenpo pi mute seme?
eng: How long has he been in a coma?

tok: jan li ken moku e telo walo ni anu seme?
eng: Is this milk still OK to drink?

tok: ona li toki e ni: "tenpo ala la mi tawa ma Elopa."
eng: He said he had never been to Europe.

tok: mi en jan pi pana sona li toki. mi pilin pona tan ni: sina kama sona pi pona mute.
eng: I just talked to your teacher and I am very proud of you. You are a very good student.

tok: jan Ton li kama ala jo e insa pi ilo mani. ona li kama jo e ilo mani a.
eng: Tom didn't steal from the cash register. He stole the whole cash register.

tok: jan Alise o, mi weka e ike sina tan ni: mi olin e sina.
eng: Alice, I forgive you because I love you.

tok: sina jo e tomo anu seme?
o kepeken e ilo wan pi ilo sitelen ni.
sina kama sona e toki Inli lon tenpo pi mute seme?
eng: How long have you been studying English?

tok: mi wile pini e ni lon tenpo suno pini.
eng: I wanted to finish this yesterday.

tok: ijo li lon tomo tawa pi mama mije.
eng: The things are in dad's car.

tok: tenpo suno pini la kon sewi li seme lon ma tomo Pekin?
eng: How was the weather yesterday in Beijing?

tok: o tawa monsi. o lape.
mama mije en mama meli li lon tomo.
eng: Both dad and mom are at home.

tok: mama mije o, poki mi li lon seme?
jan Ton o, tan seme?
jan Ton o, tan seme?
tan seme, jan Ton o?
jan Ton o, tan seme?
jan Tomaso li pali lon tomo pali. taso ona li kalama musi uta pi pona mute. ona li wile kama jan pi pali ante.
eng: Thomas is an accountant, but he has many other talents. He sings very well, and he is thinking of starting a new career. It's awesome.

tok: jan mute li kepeken e toki pona lon ilo Tatowepa.
eng: Many people use Toki Pona in Tatoeba.

tok: toki pona li pana e sona ni: kepeken nimi pona la toki li pona ala.
eng: Toki Pona teaches us that it is difficult to speak in simple terms.

tok: nanpa jan pi kama sona li mute luka lon tomo ni.
eng: The number of pupils in this room is 25.

tok: mi wile tawa anpa li wile pakala e toki pi jan mute ni. mi wile e ni: jan li sona ala e toki pi jan ante.
eng: Come ye, therefore, let us go down and there confound their tongue, that they may not understand one another's speech.

tok: meli ni la o toki ala lon poka mi.
eng: Don't talk about that woman near me.

tok: jan Ton en mi li mu pi pilin musi.
ma Pasila la mi jo e jan pona. nimi ona li Kaloso. meli ona li jan pi ma Losi. nimi ona li Malina.
eng: In Brazil I have a friend named Carlos, who is married to a Russian named Marina.

tok: jan Ton en mi li mu pi pilin musi.
taso ante lili li lon.
eng: But there is a small difference.

tok: mi ken lukin e sitelen lon sinpin.
eng: I can read the writing on the wall.

tok: tenpo ni la jan Ton li jo e jan lili tu wan.
tenpo pi pilin pona li sona ala e tenpo pini e tenpo kama.
eng: Moments of happiness know neither future nor past.

tok: toki insa li nasin musi li pali e tawa musi pi toki insa.
eng: Thinking is the art of making thoughts dance.

tok: ona li ken ala kama tan seme?
"toki. tenpo ni la sina esun e soweli tomo laso anu seme?" "ala. mi esun e soweli laso ale. tenpo ni la mi jo e soweli loje taso tawa esun."
eng: "Tell me, please, are there any blue cats left?" "There are no blue cats left. There are only red ones left."

tok: toki ante kepeken toki pona li sama toki e kon pi linja nimi kepeken nimi pi pona mute.
eng: To translate a sentence to Toki Pona is to reduce it to its simplest expression.

tok: mama sina la mama mi li suli.
eng: My parents are taller than yours.

tok: mama sina la mama mi li suli.
eng: My parents are taller than yours.

tok: jan Ton o, tan seme?
pakala pi mi mute li pana e sona tawa mi.
pipi luka meli en pipi luka mije li unpa la, pini unpa la meli li moli e mije li moku e ona.
eng: The female mantis devours the male after copulation.

tok: nimi mute li ken jo e kon sama. taso ante lili li lon.
eng: Several words can have the same meaning, with minor differences.

tok: sike ike pi sitelen tawa li kama mute tan ma pi ma Asija tawa ma Elopa.
eng: Counterfeit DVDs from Asian countries have flooded the European market.

tok: ona li moku e telo wawa pi namako kili li tawa tomo ona.
eng: He drank a glass of lemon tea and went to his room.

tok: ona mije li kama meli. ni li tawa pona.
eng: His transition from male to female is going well.

tok: sijelo li weka la kon li ken lon.
eng: The soul can exist without the body.

tok: sitelen li toki wawa.
tenpo pimeja li kama suli mute tan ni: tenpo pi lete lili li kama.
eng: The nights are getting longer because autumn is coming.

tok: sina jan pi pilin lon ala anu sina pilin lon tawa kama nasa?
eng: Are you a total unbeliever or do you believe in Chance?

tok: jan li weka e jan pi kama sona pi mute lili.
eng: A few students were left behind.

tok: mi mute o suli e mute pi linja nimi pi toki Lasina.
sina moku ala tan seme?
jan Eja Nasi li pana esun e leko ike pi kiwen loje.
tenpo lili la suno ale li kama pini.
eng: Suddenly, all the lights went off.

tok: ko kiwen li ike tawa mi.
sina wile toki e ijo tawa mi anu seme?
eng: Is there anything that you want to tell me?

tok: toki ante ni li lon. taso ona li toki ante e nimi li toki pona ala e kon.
eng: This translation is correct, but it is too literal.

tok: lawa la mi jo e linja nimi pi toki Lasina pi mute lili. pilin mi la ona li lon. mi sona ala e ni: tan seme la jan ala li mama ona?
eng: I adopted some Latin phrases, which seemed correct to me. I don't know why they weren't owned by anyone.

tok: jan ale li ken kama jo e linja nimi pi toki moli sama toki Lasina e linja nimi pi toki jan sama toki pona anu toki Epelanto.
eng: Anyone can adopt sentences in dead languages like Latin or artificial languages like Toki Pona and Esperanto.

tok: ijo pi pona ale li lon ala.
eng: There's no such thing as perfection.

tok: ona li weka e toki wile ona.
mi toki e ni tawa ona: mi wile sona e tan. mi sona wawa e ni: ona li pana e sona ni tawa mi.
eng: I've requested an explanation and I'm confident I'll get one.

tok: mi toki e ni tawa ona: mi wile sona e tan. mi sona wawa e ni: ona li pana e sona ni tawa mi.
eng: I've requested an explanation and I'm confident I'll get one.

tok: mi pana e mani mute, taso ona li jan suli pi pana sona.
eng: I pay dearly but he is a great teacher.

tok: mani pali ona li mute. taso ona li jan pi pana sona pi pona mute.
eng: His salary is high, but he is a great teacher.

tok: ona li pilin e ijo mute.
eng: He had thought of a lot of things.

tok: toki Lasina la nimi pi poka pi nimi pali li kama lon tenpo nanpa wan, nimi pali li kama lon tenpo nanpa tu.
eng: In the Latin language, adverbs precede verbs.

tok: nimi ale li kama ala ante lon toki pona.
eng: In Toki Pona, all words are invariable.

tok: "telo Mesitelane li telo pi wawa lili anu seme?" "ala. tenpo pi mute lili la telo suli en telo pi wawa mute li lon."
eng: "Is the Mediterranean a calm sea?" "Not really, sometimes there can be very big waves."

tok: tomo pi jan ala la ko lili li selo e supa ale.
eng: All the furniture in the abandoned house was covered with dust.

tok: mi wile kama sin anu seme?
jan li toki e ni: jan Ekule li jan lili pi jan Amena li jan pi wawa mute a! jan ante ale li wawa lili.
eng: Hercules, the son of Alcmena, is said to have been the strongest of all men.

tok: jan sewi Juno li meli lawa pi jan sewi li olin ala e jan Amena li wile moli e jan Ekule. jan Ekule li lili mute.
eng: Juno, the queen of the gods, hated Alcmena and wanted to kill Hercules while he was still a child.

tok: ona li pana e akesi tu pi wawa mute tawa tomo lape pi jan Amena lon insa pi tenpo pimeja. jan Ekule en jan sama ona li lape lon tomo ni.
eng: She then dispatched two very fierce serpents, which came in the middle of the night to the room of Alcmena, where Hercules and his brother were sleeping.

tok: taso supa lape pi jan lili li selo suli. akesi li kama lon poka pi jan lili li open tawa e selo. jan lili li pini lape.
eng: However, they were not in a cradle but in a large shield. The snakes approached and started moving the shield, which made the boys wake up.

tok: jan Isike li jan sama pi jan Ekule li kalama uta wawa. taso jan Ekule sama li jan lili pi wawa kin li pilin ala monsuta.
eng: Iphicles, Hercules' brother, gave a loud cry; but Hercules himself, a stout boy, was not afraid at all.

tok: pipi lili li ken lukin e pilin ona anu seme? nasa la pipi wan li lukin jo e moku, la pipi lili mute li kama tawa ma sama.
eng: I wonder if ants are connected by telepathy. It is strange that when one of them finds food, many others then appear in the same place.

tok: jan ni li pona ala tawa jan Mewi: ona li sama jan Ton tawa lukin.
eng: Mary doesn't like men who look like Tom.

tok: jan lawa li tawa weka la jan pali ona li awen toki ala li kute e kalama pi len noka sewi ona. ni la ona li ken sona e ni: jan lawa li weka.
eng: As the boss was walking away the employees remained silent, listening for the clicking of her heels against the floor, to make sure that she really had left.

tok: tenpo pini la mi kute e kalama tan waso pi jan lawa ala lon ma kasi ni.
eng: I used to listen to the calls of the wild birds in this forest.

tok: sina wile ala wile e pan?
nasin sitelen sin li pona mute tawa mi.
eng: I love new systems of writing.

tok: tenpo ni la ona li jo e noka lawa pi akesi tu li pakala e ona kepeken wawa mute. nasin ni la jan lili li moli e akesi.
eng: He immediately grabbed the snakes with his little hands and crushed their necks with great force. In this way, the snakes were killed by the boy.

tok: toki Lasina la nimi pali li lon pini pi linja nimi lon tenpo ale lili.
eng: In Latin, the verb usually comes at the end of the sentence.

tok: taso jan Amena li mama meli pi jan lili tu li kute e kalama li pini e lape pi mije ona.
eng: But Alcmena, the boys' mother, heard the scream and woke her husband.

tok: ona li open e suno li jo e palisa utala li tawa wawa tawa jan lili li kama li lukin e ijo nasa kin: jan Ekule li mu musi li pana e akesi moli tawa lukin.
eng: He turned on the light and, taking his sword, ran to the boys, but when he got there he saw an amazing thing, for Hercules was laughing showing off the dead serpents.

tok: o telo e kili loje o weka e linja ona.
eng: Wash the strawberries and remove their stalks.

tok: ona li nasa lili tawa kute.
nasin tawa ma tomo Loma li mute li ante.
eng: There are many ways to get to Rome.

tok: sona mute li lon kulupu ilo. ni la sona mute pi kepeken ala kin li lon ona.
eng: The Internet has a lot of information and thus also a lot of useless information.

tok: sina sona pona e toki Inli la, toki Lasina li pali lili kin.
eng: If you handle English, Latin will be a piece of cake.

tok: tenpo suno ale la mi toki kepeken toki Inli. taso ona li awen toki ante tawa mi.
eng: English is still a foreign language to me, even though I speak it every day.

tok: wawa ala sina li seme?
telo kiwen li suli lili. telo li suli mute.
nimi 123 li lon toki pona. nimi ni li kama tan ma mute.
eng: Toki Pona has a vocabulary of 123 words, derived from several languages.

tok: jan li ken kepeken e nanpa suli lon toki pona.
eng: Large numbers can be used in Toki Pona.

eng: From childhood, Hercules exercised diligently, spending most of the day at the gymnasium; and he learned to shoot with a bow and arrow.

tok: toki pi ma ale li toki Inli taso. tenpo suli pini la toki pi ma ale li toki Lasina. toki Epelanto li wile kama toki pi ma ale kin. toki pona li ken wile kama toki pi ma ale kin anu seme?
eng: The only truly international language is English. Long ago it was Latin. Esperanto is a candidate. Does Toki Pona stand a chance?

tok: tenpo pini la jan Ton taso li tawa weka tan tomo poki ni.
eng: Tom was the only person to ever escape from that prison.

tok: toki pi ma ale li toki Inli taso. tenpo suli pini la toki pi ma ale li toki Lasina. toki Epelanto li wile kama toki pi ma ale kin. toki pona li ken wile kama toki pi ma ale kin anu seme?
eng: The only truly international language is English. Long ago it was Latin. Esperanto is a candidate. Does Toki Pona stand a chance?

eng: Despite everything, I like Toki Pona mainly because I see the possibility of modestly contributing to its continued practice until it becomes, who knows, an instrument of easy international communication.

eng: From childhood, Hercules exercised diligently, spending most of the day at the gymnasium; and he learned to shoot with a bow and arrow.

eng: To translate a sentence into Toki Pona is to express its meaning in very simple terms.

eng: "If the translation is correct, why don't you like it?" "Because it was made by a machine."

tok: ni li nasin pali mi.

jan sama mama mi li jan sona pi nasin lawa.

eng: Some sentences admit several possibilities of translation.

tok: jan sama mama mi li jan sona pi nasin lawa.

eng: She doesn't put sugar in her coffee.

eng: If something is not forbidden, then is it allowed?

tok: ni li tomo pi pali pan.

eng: That Portuguese sentence admits innumerable possibilities for translation. Many of these versions are found on Tatoeba.

tok: sitelen lape li kama lon.
nanpa la ona li lon.

tok: pan li pona.
pan li pona.

tok: jan li toki e ni: tenpo ni la ma li tawa sike kepeken wawa sin.

tok: o pana e lipu lon tenpo suno kama.

tok: pan li pona.

eng: The particle "li" is sometimes equivalent to the verb "to be", which does not exist in Toki Pona.

tok: jan pona mi pi sike suno mute li jo e lawa wawa a. ona li toki e linja sitelen tan tenpo lili ona la mi pilin e ni: linja sitelen ni li kama lon tenpo suno pini.
eng: An old friend of mine has a privileged memory. He recounts scenes from his youth as if they happened yesterday.

tok: sina o pali e ni. jan ante o pali ala e ona.
sina o pali e ni. jan ante o pali ala e ona.
sina o pali e ni. jan ante o pali ala e ona.
mi sona e ona la mi wile ala lon.
eng: I should not live if I knew.

tok: nasin seme la sina ken pali e ona a!
kulupu jan Juta li jo kin e nimi Iwi e nimi Isale.
eng: Jews are also known as Hebrews and Israelites.

tok: sina jo ala jo e ilo open pi poki ni?
eng: Do you have the key to this suitcase?

tok: musi pi jan lawa tu la jan Manu Kasen li kama jo e mani pi utala nanpa tu wan pi ma ale.
eng: Magnus Carlsen won third world chess title.

tok: sina ken seme pona?
pakala ale li sama ala pali nasa.

tok: supa lape pi mute seme li lon tomo pi pona sijelo?
eng: How many beds does the hospital have?

mi lukin e pali sina.
nimi li lon ala la, ijo poka li pana e sona.

tok: mi sitelen e linja nimi mute lon nimi "jasima".

tok: nasin mute la jan li ken toki e ijo lon toki pona.

eng: He didn't go to the lake.

tok: ona li tawa ala telo.
eng: She didn't go to the lake.

tok: jan ala li jo e kon.
sina lukin e sitelen tawa lon tenpo pini la sitelen tawa li pona ala pona tawa sina?
eng: What did you think of the movie?

tok: jan Ton li sona e toki mute.
eng: Tom knows a lot of languages.

tok: jan Ton li sona e toki mute.
jan Ton li sona e toki mute.
eng: Tom knows a lot of languages.

tok: jan Ton li ken kepeken toki mute.
tan seme, jan Ton o?

eng: Ms. Sonja gathered her students together and said, "I am giving you 123 words. Now see if you can build a new language with just these words."

tok: jan Ton li sona e toki mute.
eng: Tom knows a lot of languages.

tok: linja nimi nanpa tu li toki ante ala e nimi pi linja nimi nanpa wan, li toki ante e kon pi linja nanpa wan.
eng: The sentence does not translate the literal meaning, but the actual intended meaning.

tok: jan Ton li wile toki e wile sona pi mute lili.
jan Ton li kama lukin e ma pi kasi suli lon ma ko suli pi telo ala.
tenpo ala la o tawa wawa ala pini.
olin li ijo pi pana sona pi pona mute a. ala li sama ona.
mi sitelen e linja nimi lon toki mute lon lipu Tatowepa tan ni: ni la jan pi pana sona li lon li wile pona e linja nimi mi.
eng: I write sentences in several languages in Tatoeba because I trust the teachers who are here willing to correct my mistakes.

tok: sina wile ala wile e ni: mi pana e sona pi kalama musi ni tawa sina?
eng: Do you want me to teach you that song?

tok: jan ala li jo e kon.
sona mi la toki ante pi lipu ni kepeken toki Kanse li lon ala.
eng: As far as I know, this book has never been translated into French.

tok: pakala pi tenpo suno pini li wile pana e sona tawa sina lon tenpo suno ni.

tok: sina wile pana e sona pi ijo ni, la o pana e ijo sama tawa lukin.

eng: Our forefathers would not have given the name of Senate to our supreme council if they did not see in the elders the virtues of prudence, common sense and reason.

eng: The faculties of the elderly are preserved as long as they remain active and interested in life.

eng: In Toki Pona, "telo" means "water". In Russian, "тело" means "body". And water is the main constituent of the (human) body.

eng: Portuguese and Spanish are such similar languages that sometimes two sentences - one in Portuguese, the other in Spanish - seem to be written in the same language.

tok: jan li ken kama olin e jan tan ijo pona.

eng: You can talk with me in any of my languages, but I'm most comfortable with French.

tok: toki mi la, sina ken toki tawa mi lon ni: sina wile toki e toki ni. taso toki pi pona mute pali tawa mi li toki Kanse.

tok: olin li wan e ona tu. tenpo pi utala mute la ona tu li wan kin. tenpo ni kin la ona tu li awen e lupa sama.
eng: Great affection united them; in battles, they were always together; and even now they both stood guard at the same door.

eng: Everyone, the people in general and the elders in particular wanted Aeneas to be called back, to send messengers to inform him of the situation.

eng: A bloody spectacle was expected, but the lions didn't attack Tom. However, when a soldier approached, they immediately fell upon him and devoured him.

eng: Honor your father with all your heart, and do not forget your mother's labor pains. Remember that by them you were begotten, and try to repay them for what you have received from them.
